noun.description: A particular form of something differing in certain respects from an earlier form or other forms of the same type of thing.
examples: a revised version of the paper was produced for a later meeting
they produce yachts in both standard and master versions

noun.description: An account of a matter from a particular person's point of view.
examples: he told her his version of events

noun.description: The manual turning of a fetus in the uterus to make delivery easier.

examples: it's the software for you if you need versioning and group editing

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense translation): from French, or from medieval Latin versio(n-), from Latin vertere to turn.
